intro: Tetratheca aphylla, commonly known as the leafless tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its lack of leaves, with only small, scale-like structures present. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically found in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
